meanings.definition: To disturb the composure of; perturb.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise discomposes the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected news discomposes her calm demeanor.
meanings.sent3: The clown's silly antics discomposes the serious atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: The sudden storm discomposes the tranquility of the lake.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence of the abandoned house discomposes visitors.

meanings.definition: To put out of order; disarrange.
meanings.sent1: The mischievous child discomposes the neatly stacked books.
meanings.sent2: The strong wind discomposes the carefully arranged flowers.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy discomposes the tidy living room.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected guest discomposes the planned seating arrangement.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake discomposes the organized shelves in the library.

meanings.definition: To upset the order of; disarray.
meanings.sent1: The miscommunication discomposes the scheduled events.
meanings.sent2: The careless mistake discomposes the structured timeline.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel discomposes the neatly arranged nuts.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected visitor discomposes the peaceful routine.
meanings.sent5: The strong wave discomposes the carefully built sandcastle.
